title: Bruins Wrap: B‚Äôs Beat Sharks 2-1 In OT, Extend Win Streak To Four Games | Bruins Wrap | NESN.com
text:
Sharks defenseman Brent Burns picked up an assist on Marleau‚Äôs tally, giving him 64 points on the season, which ties him with Sidney Crosby for second place on the league‚Äôs scoring leaderboard. 
CLEAN GAME There wasn‚Äôt a whole lot of feistiness between these teams. Boston and San Jose took two minor penalties apiece, with both teams going 0-for-2 on the power play. The Bruins entered the game with the second-best penalty kill in the league. 
There were no penalties in the third period or overtime. 
TUUKKA REAL GOOD Rask, after a week off, showed no rust in Boston‚Äôs net. The B‚Äôs goaltender stopped 29 of the 30 shots he faced to earn his 28th win of the season. Rask has stopped 79 of 81 shots over his last three games. 
MVP MARCHAND Marchand ended the game with a breakaway goal in overtime that was set up by a nice pass from defenseman Torey Krug. . @BMarch63 with the OT winner üôå

UP NEXT The Bruins resume their road Wednesday in Anaheim against the Ducks. Puck drop is scheduled for 10:30 p.m. ET.
